paper.name: Paper
beforeDisposal: Clean paper can be directly recycled
Oily or heavily soiled paper should go into Other Waste (Gray bin)

aluminiumCans.name: Aluminium Cans
beforeDisposal: Empty the contents
Rinse if possible
Lightly crush to save space

clothing.name: Clothing
beforeDisposal: Clean and wearable clothes can be recycled
Heavily damaged or soiled clothes should go into Other Waste
If available, use special clothing donation or recycling bins

glass.name: Glass
beforeDisposal: Clean intact glass items before recycling
Broken glass should be securely wrapped to prevent injury
Depending on local rules, it may be classified as Other Waste or Recyclables

electronics.name: Electronics
electronics.binColor: Red (Hazardous Waste) or Designated E-waste collection point
beforeDisposal: Do not throw in regular bins
Batteries (especially button or lithium batteries) are hazardous
Use official recycling programs via community, NGOs, or e-commerce platforms

plasticWastes.name: Plastic Wastes
beforeDisposal: Rinse plastic items to remove food or liquid residues.
Dry them to avoid contamination.
Remove caps or labels if specified by local recycling rules.

organicWastes.name: Organic Wastes
beforeDisposal: Remove plastic packaging from food.
Drain excess liquid to reduce mess and smell.
Avoid mixing with non-biodegradable items.
